titleStmt.title: The virgin's complaint against young mens unkindness. Of young mens falshood she doth much complain, resolving never to love man again: experience tells her men love but for fashion, that makes her rail against them in such passion. To the tune of, Cupid's courtesie, &c.

The virgin's complaint against young mens unkindness. Of young mens falshood she doth much complain, resolving never to love man again: experience tells her men love but for fashion, that makes her rail against them in such passion. To the tune of, Cupid's courtesie, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for A[lexander]. M[ilbourn]. W[illiam]. O[nley]. and T[homas]. Thackeray, at the Angel in Duck lane,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "I am so deep in love ..."
Place, date of publication, and publisher's names from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
